description: Unique identifier for the part record in the inventory/catalog, used across transactions and references.
Code for the storeroom or warehouse where the item is managed and stored.
System-generated unique numeric ID for this item record, used for internal joins and references.
Identifier linking this item to an equivalent/alternate part group for interchangeability; likely equals itself when no alternates; confirm with SME.
Binary flag indicating whether the item uses a barcode for identification and scanning.
Divisor used to scale scanned barcode quantities to the inventory unit of measure; confirm with SME.
Alternate barcode value associated with an equivalent part for cross-referencing; confirm with SME.
Item category or classification code for reporting, purchasing, or accounting controls.
Indicates the item carries a core return/deposit requirement.
Monetary amount of the core deposit per unit.
Cycle-count classification indicating how frequently the item should be counted.
Status of the current or most recent cycle count for the item.
Date the latest cycle count adjustment was posted to inventory.
Date the item master record was last modified.
Most recent date the item was issued or consumed.
Primary short description of the item.
Secondary description or additional details for the item.
Indicates whether economic order quantity logic is enabled for this item.
Flag for handling unit/packaging requirement or special handling; likely denotes items issued in handling units; confirm with SME.
Primary bin or shelf location of the item within the storeroom.
Minimum stock level (reorder point) before replenishment is triggered.
Markup percentage applied to the item’s cost for pricing.
Maximum desired on-hand stock level.
Maximum quantity allowed to be issued in a single transaction.
User or operator ID that last updated the item record.
Supplier lead time required to replenish the item.
Unit of measure for the lead time (for example, days or weeks); confirm with SME.
Current on-hand quantity in inventory.
Safety stock quantity intended to buffer against demand or supply variability.
Indicator or factor for seasonal demand patterns; confirm with SME.
Lifecycle status of the item (e.g., active or inactive).
Taxability code used to determine applicable sales or use tax treatment.
Time of day when the item record was last modified.
Item type/class code (such as stocked part, tool, or service); confirm with SME.
Current standard unit cost of the item, excluding freight and taxes.
Unit of measure used when issuing the item from inventory.
Unit of measure used when purchasing the item.
Conversion factor between purchase unit and issue unit of measure.
Preferred or primary supplier for the item.
Reference key for the last work order or transaction that consumed this item; confirm with SME.
Alternate internal or supplier part number for cross-reference.
Supplier catalog identifier for the item.
Manufacturer’s part number.
Link or identifier for the item’s safety data sheet (SDS/MSDS).
User-defined reference field for additional notes or codes (slot 1).
User-defined reference field for additional notes or codes (slot 2).
User-defined reference field for additional notes or codes (slot 3).
User-defined reference field for additional notes or codes (slot 4).
Indicates the item is non-stock (special order or direct purchase).
Economic or accounting classification code (level 1), such as cost center or GL mapping; confirm with SME.
Economic or accounting classification code (level 2); confirm with SME.
Economic or accounting classification code (level 3); confirm with SME.
Purchasing or pricing unit code; confirm with SME.
Flag indicating inclusion in physical inventory processes or counts; confirm with SME.
Mean time between failures cycle category for planned replacement; confirm with SME.
Length of the MTBF cycle for this item; unit defined elsewhere; confirm with SME.
Secondary or overflow bin location for the item.
ABC classification based on unit carrying cost to prioritize inventory control.
Standard VMRS code classifying the part for fleet maintenance reporting.
ABC classification based on extended value consumption (usage times cost).
Allowable variance from the calculated economic order quantity when placing orders.
Indicates that EOQ is manually overridden for this item.
Most recent purchase unit cost paid for the item.
Reorder or replenishment type code (e.g., stocked, non-stock, repairable); confirm with SME.
Tax component used in cost calculations for the item; confirm with SME if amount or rate.
Freight or shipping cost component per unit.
Fully burdened unit cost including base cost and adders such as freight and tax.
Indicator that notes or attachments exist for this item.
Reference to an image or diagram for the item; likely a file identifier or flag; confirm with SME.
